info.title: Sourcing Project Negotiation Events
info.description:
A negotiation is a process between a purchaser and the potential suppliers to arrive at the best buying terms after the supplier has submitted a quotation in a sourcing project.

The following events are available for a negotiation:

 * Negotiation published
 * Negotiation canceled
 * Negotiation completed
 * Negotiation ended

x-sap-shortText: Informs a remote system about published, canceled, completed, and ended sourcing project negotiation in an SAP SAP S/4HANA system.

message.description: This event is raised when a negotiation is canceled.
This event is raised when a negotiation is completed.
This event is raised when a negotiation is marked as ended.
This event is raised when a negotiation is published.

sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.sourcingprojectnegotiation.v1.SourcingProjectNegotiation.Canceled.v1
sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.description: This event is raised when a negotiation is canceled.

sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.sourcingprojectnegotiation.v1.SourcingProjectNegotiation.Completed.v1
sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.description: This event is raised when a negotiation is completed.

sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.sourcingprojectnegotiation.v1.SourcingProjectNegotiation.NegotiationEnded.v1
sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.description: This event is raised when a negotiation is marked as ended.

sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.sourcingprojectnegotiation.v1.SourcingProjectNegotiation.Published.v1
sap_s4_beh_sourcingprojectnegotiation_v1.description: This event is raised when a negotiation is published.

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.
